website_summaries.verdict: Offers a combination of appealing features as well as some concerns that are common to similar hoses.
pros: Very lightweight, flexible, and easy to maneuver
Connectors of made of solid brass
We like that the 8-pattern nozzle has a thumb control that makes it simple to change functions while you work
cons: Material can puncture if it comes in contact with jagged objects
Doesn't expand to the full 50-foot length

customer_reviews.title: Great product and outstanding customer service
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the hose, but had problem with the hose nozzle. I wrote an email to The FitLife and within minutes, I had a reply that said they were sorry about the nozzle and would immediately send a replacement. Still skeptical, I waited to submit a revised review but within three days, the replacement nozzle was here. I am extremely satisfied with the product and amazed at the great customer service. I definitely would do business with this The FitLife company. Only reason I didn't rate durability is that the hose is still new.
customer_reviews.author: losalkings

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had expanding garden hoses in the past, but this one is the best I've used. It's well built, with brass connectors, giving the impression that it will last quite a while--because the material is of greater quality, and heavier, and the internal core is stronger. I'm very happy with this. The instructions say to keep it out of the sun when not in use, which is impossible in my garden, so I have no idea how this may affect the hose's long-term health. However, in my last home, a much cheaper brand was stored in the shade, and went to pieces fairly quickly. So it's all about quality--and the FitLife looks like it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: This hose is not 25 feet by any stretch of the imagination
customer_reviews.text: This product is a total waste. It's about 8 feet long. There is zero expanding. Honestly I liked it when I opened it. I like the metal fittings and it seemed like the perfect product. If you need an 8 foot hose this will be perfect for you but my needed length was 18 feet and it didn't even reach halfway. I don't think I could stretch this thing to 25 feet if I tried... so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Easily attaches to other rubber hoses
customer_reviews.text: I love this expandable hose. It immediately connected to a shorter hose that’s attached to the house faucet and I was able to take it inside my sunroom to water all my plants. The settings on the attached sprayer were perfect for selecting the type of spray I needed. We have a large yard and previously used large rubber hoses. But now I can effortlessly water plants and trees. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Darla Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 60 days
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only 51 days of light use. The product description says there is a 180-day warranty. Amazon closes the return window after 30 days. They now expect me to contact the manufacturer and send this piece of junk back, at my expense I’m sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this hose!
customer_reviews.text: I love this hose! I can’t believe I love a hose but I do! So nice and light! I like all the different spray choices too. I’m so happy to be rid of my heavy, space taking, ugly regular hose. This one saves a lot of space and doesn’t look horrible like regular hoses. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: WhatTheFluff

customer_reviews.title: Best EXPANDABLE hose ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best expandable hose ever. I bought two different hoses at the same time and this hose is by far the better one. It doesn’t feel flimsy - seems way more durable!!
customer_reviews.author: Love2shop

customer_reviews.title: Slammed by Assurion 3 year protection insurance.
customer_reviews.text: It came apart at the fitting. I purchased the addition insurance only to be stiffed by them when I tried to file s claim.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerwanab

customer_reviews.title: Great hose investment 👍
customer_reviews.text: Really nice hose. It can stretch, it can shrink. I had the water pressure on full blast while the valve is closed for upwards of an hour without leaks or anything. The nozzle is decent, and has several options. Great for car washes as well as garden watering. The jet stream even though a really tight stream, isn't all that powerful. The connection and nozzle feels cheap, but has no problem performing so far. Replacing that old cheap grey hose with this was a great thing. Putting this up is also easy since it auto shrinks as water is expelled from the hose. As well, the hose fills up really fast and builds pressure in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Two holes in less then two months
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was going to like due to its flexibility and light weight, but two holes in less then two months and no way to repair. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: EAR

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t lucky with this hose. I actually bought 2, (50feet and 100feet) and both broke after 3 weeks. Very disappointed. Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lilian

customer_reviews.title: LASTED 8 MONTHS, THEN BURSTED.  LEAKING.
customer_reviews.text: Bursted after 8 months of use; it was great before it broke. No longer eligible for refund
customer_reviews.author: leo siongco

customer_reviews.title: Terrible water pressure!!
customer_reviews.text: I am actually annoyed at all the nice reviews because the water pressure with this hose sucks!! I'm comparing it to my standard hoses which have allow strong water pressure but are much more bulky which is why I wanted a more compact lighter hose. I adjusted both levers to allow for maximum water pressure but even then it's weak. I suppose this hose is nice if you don't care about weak water pressure..
customer_reviews.author: ponzies

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I received this hose yesterday and immediately hooked it up. Water sprays out of the nozzle from places it shouldn't - such as the back of the handle - and not just a little bit of water. I immediately decided this needed to be returned. When I grabbed the metal end to unscrew it, I sliced my thumb open on a metal shard.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted for my back yard!
customer_reviews.text: This hose is just what I wanted for my backyard. It extends 100' to reach the back of my hose to my fence line, so there is a lot of coverage. Yet, it is lightweight and easy to maneuver. And best of all, there is no irritating kinking and it stores away with a small footprint. I like the valve too because I use this hose for pressure washing the back deck and the valve allows for easy connection and disconnection from the powerwasher. Tip: let the pressure build-up in the hose before using and let all the water drain out before storing it.
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Unique design. Well built.
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these collapsible hoses and they all end up leaking at the end or come off completely. This hose seems to be well built with metal connectors. The design is different in that it resembles the design of a bendable straw, like an accordion. It will not expand fully unless pressure has built up and retracts slightly when the water is flowing. This tends to make the usable hose length less by 3' or so. So far so good. Time will tell if it is worth the extra cost compared to a cheaper hose.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Molick

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 3 i bought still work
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 of these hoses because I liked the reviews and really need a retractable/expandable hoses. Only 1 of the 3 I bought still work, in under a year with minimal use! 2 started leaking so much from the water spigot that there was no pressure to get any water from the hand held nozzle. Now I need yet ANOTHER hose, and am on the search for something that doesn't leak, crack, disintegrate and isn't disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Moragan Keyes

customer_reviews.title: Great hose, while it lasts, and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I love flex hoses, their light weight, no kinking, and maneuverability are unbeatable and make it easier for this senior gardener to handle. I have had at least a half a dozen of them from various companies through the years. NONE have lasted much more than a year, and most lasted less than that. ALL develop a pinhole leak sooner or later. This one lasted eight months. But at least this company honored their one-year warranty and graciously sent a free replacement right away. I am afraid I'll just keep buying a new one every year.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia M.

customer_reviews.title: Updated: This hose broke in multiple places warranty not honored
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I was fairly impressed with the build quality of this hose. However, after few months of use, it broke in multiple places and water was not even reaching the nozzle. I reached out to FitLife for a warranty replacement and somehow they were not able to find my order (even after I sent them a screenshot) and punted me back to Amazon. Needless to say I DO NOT RECCOMEND this product!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Develops leaks in the tube
customer_reviews.text: I bought this six months or so ago. It was for my small back yard. Never abused or handless roughly. For first few months it worked great but two months ago started having tiny holes in the rubber. Initially it was two holes now there are too many to count. Now it’s unusable I do not recommend this product It works for 3 or 3 months then in develops leaks. It’s a wast of your money
customer_reviews.author: Zohey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is flexible and yes it is light weight but what good is it if he is so weak that it springs a leak withing the first two months? And we didn't even use it every day. And they cut off returning it on July 1st when we bought it in June. No wonder they cut it off so fast because they know these hoses do not last! Don't buy it!! And if decide to buy such a hose go to a reputable store that will stand behind the products you sell.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: need little room space for storage
customer_reviews.text: Great garden hose lightweight easy to move. Easy to roll up when not in use takes up very little space when not in use. Can't say about durability because I just used it couple times.These type of hoses will break. i am using these type from past couple of years. if you are lucky it will work for more then a year. i love them because no hassel in putting and taking them. i use them for general yard watering.Nice product, very light and easy to take it anywhere. Compact when not in use - takes very little room. Fills and works just like a normal hose.
customer_reviews.author: Mahe

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Don’t usually write reviews but, buyer beware! This hose is a piece of junk. Don’t waste your money. I purchased the 100’ hose knowing I’d never need more than 50’ stretch and after a month it started to leak. In another week while washing my car the inner hose split completely rendering it useless, naturally my window to return past so into the trash can it goes and a trip to big box store for a real hose I go.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The first one broke the third time I used it - the nozzle started spraying water through the middle portion and hose stopped coiling up after use. The replacement did the same thing after the first use. I have three other hoses at my home that I use with Home Depot spray nozzles and they have been working for 3 years. I decided to try this one because of the advertized features, but item is defective and poor quality except for the heavy brass fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Z

customer_reviews.title: Kink King, no stretch
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these hoses, they tend to last about a year. Never bought this brand before this year. I would not recommend it. It kinks worse than an old plastic hose and there is no stretch in it. Lesson I learned long ago and ignored when ordering this, you get what you pay for. I will be ordering another one soon, but never this brand again. time to lick my wounds and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Bangs

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I usually use a 50 ft thick heavy hose to reach my garden. I hurt my back and thought if try this it might be easier and less chance of pulling on my back out. It is so much easier. It keeps me from pulling on my back as I'm puttingthe hose away. I can hang it really easily. I love that this is double the length of what I was using but so light and easy to move around. The sprayer works well. Few spray options are great to have of course. The hardware is really heavy duty so I think if I take of this, it's going to last a long time. Happy gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Silly Butt

customer_reviews.title: No pressure, 8', pressure, 25'. I bought a 25' hose to drain my A/C unit... but there's no pressure.
customer_reviews.text: The product description should START with, that you need water pressure for this hose to be at 25' and that the hose is only 8' if you don't have any water pressure. Sometimes, we're not buying it for sprinkling our yard. I didn't do a thorough product read because... it's a hose. It says it's a 25' hose. I don't need a fancy hose, or a weird hose, I just need a 25' long piece of plastic tubing to drain my A/C. This doesn't do that, so for me, clearly just one star.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Turner

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious!
customer_reviews.text: Update: after using this hose a COUPLE of times it lost its shape, it lost over half of the water pressure it had and it totally sucks! I hate this hose and am going to buy a different one. Totally disappointed! Just got this hose today. I bought a 100ft to replace the few in my backyard. I really like it and it expands great but I am seriously worried about the fabric on it. I think I'm gonna have to be seriously careful around my landscaping bricks. This house snags and I think it will be the end of it. I wouldn't buy another one that's a fact!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful behavior but VERY VERY fragile.
customer_reviews.text: We got two of these because my wife was looking forward to the lightness and flexibility. She was delighted for the first two weeks. That was when the first one sprung a leak. It was in the garden and may have encountered something sharp. The second one lasted another week before it too sprung a leak. It was lying on a deck and it is possible that it encountered something sharp. We do have some cactus on the deck but not in a place where I expected them to meet with the hose. Sigh. It seemed like a good idea but both hoses are gone now.
customer_reviews.author: John D Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 Months!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these in May and in July it has sprung leaks/holes up right near to where it screw onto the water outlet.....RATS! Was a waste of good money! REVIEW ALERT!: PLEASE Ignore my previous Review and the 1 Star I gave this product, it was another "Senor Moment", I realized later that the expandable hose that had sprung this leak was my original F.Hose, which is maybe 2 years old at least....this 25" was added to the older 50'er.
customer_reviews.author: orbeavhawk

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: At first, this hose worked really well. After the winter, we started seeing leaks around the nozzle where it attaches to the water spigot. Now, it’s a full on gushing of water. Less than a year later, I’m looking to buy a replacement hose because this one is busted.
customer_reviews.author: JessThy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight kink-free expandable hose
customer_reviews.text: We needed a watering hose for the garden and this hose works great for the following reasons: - Nice quality and make. - Lightweight despite its long length of 100 ft (when filled with water). - Easy storage as actual length is short i.e. it lengthens when it is filled with water and shortens when the water drains out. - Kink-free and easy to maneuver. - Solid brass fittings on each end that don't dent easily. - Connector on one end has an on/off valve so you can shut/stop water flow in the hose. - Comes with extra 2 sets of washers (big and small) as well as a spray nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: NWMTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH the money. Stay AWAY!!
customer_reviews.text: Thought that this hose would be ideal to cover the 50’ needed for my front yard. Was I WRONG!!!! The hose is well made however, not only does it not come close to the advertised length, the water pressure is minimal with the exception of one nozzle setting. The biggest complaint I have is if the ground or concrete is not perfectly smooth (driveway is an aggregate mix) it will snag and bind up. I would NOT recommend spending either time or money looking at this product. Going back to a regular garden hose that I know I can depend on.
customer_reviews.author: rodnewguy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money - leaks like crazy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hose at the end of last year to use this summer - opened it up and hooked it up about 45 days ago - and I turn it on and use it once a day to water my patio plants - it now leaks in multiple locations. It also contracts and turns weirdly to the point that it almost jerks out of my hand. What a waste of money - I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THAT PIECE OF JUNK!!
customer_reviews.author: Sondra C

customer_reviews.title: Hose Lasted 6 Months - Blew Out
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in our back patio for watering our plants and it function fine for 6 months. No abuse - coiled after every use. Today it started spraying from an apparent internal tear and, shortly after, the internal stretchy hose part blew out and it's no longer functional. I would recommend buying a different hose from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: El Queso Grande

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me! Such a piece of s—-! I have had this approximately 6 weeks, do not even water with it everyday. Just went out and this supposed hose just blew a giant hole in it. I read the instructions very carefully, always followed the sequence exactly! Do not, I repeat DO NOT buy this hose, it is junk, and not cheap junk!
customer_reviews.author: debra juarez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hose
customer_reviews.text: The hose is connected to the hose bib in my garage so its use has been limited to hosing down the front of the house and the driveway and for washing the car. I love the convenience of having it fit in a small bucket when not in use. It's very lightweight and easy to handle and the fittings look strong enough for long-term use. The pressure stream on the Jet setting isn't as strong as I had hoped but it's satisfactory. I would highly recommend this product, at least in my area where we don't have much of a weather problem (California).
customer_reviews.author: Ms. P

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered two of these, one shorter hose and one very long hose. At first I really thought they were amazing products, they were very light, expanded quite a bit and worked very well. The problem with these are that the inner core does not last long. Both of the hoses I ordered the inner core broke near the end of the faucet. They are not very sturdy and they lasted about two months or so. While the price is nice they are not rugged whatsoever. Spend the money and get a hose that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Levi_1976

customer_reviews.title: Exploded after 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this hose at first. I have a small patio on my condo. The 25' hose was long enough to reach my potted plants with ease then rolled up easily into an empty pot. But yesterday (Aug 2) while watering it just exploded all over. I paid almost $29 for this hose and that's a lot for only a few months of use. I purchased in March 2020 but didn't need it until May 2020. Then used twice a day to water a few potted plants on my condo patio. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Roslyn Niebuhr

customer_reviews.title: Better
customer_reviews.text: I got this in place of a regular heavy duty hose. When the water to the hose is off, yes it is very light weight and takes up very little space. But when the water to the hose is on, it’s not as easy to maneuver around as I thought it would be. Yes, it is less heavier than a regular heavy duty hose, but I think I need to get some hose guides for my gardens because of the material getting caught on bags, brick walls and such which makes it very Hard to just pull it when you’re walking around watering.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Leaker
customer_reviews.text: I was optimistic as soon as I opened the package but... The end of the hose with the shut off valve leaked the first time I used the hose. I returned for a credit and haven't decided on a replacement. If it had not leaked, I think it would have been a great hose. I like the way it expanded and contracted without kinking.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and light but broke too soon
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine till it broke after few months. The inner tube broke and came out of the valve.
customer_reviews.author: Shilpi(shjaiswa)

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Love this hose, it is as they described, very light weight, once the pressure is released it shrivels back into a bundle that you can easily store practically anywhere. Takes very little room. The connections are solid machined brass, and the outer covering is a pliable soft fabric that seems very durable. I am sure his hose will last a very long time. My primary use is for car washing, and general watering of the garden beds around my house. A solid buy .
customer_reviews.author: forbiddenapple

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after less than 60 days
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. I was a bit skeptical before buying because there are plenty of reviews with leaks, but I thought that because of the 4 star reviews it may not happen to me- wrong! I even bought two of those hoses for front and backyard, but both broke after about 1-2 months of very light usage.
customer_reviews.author: ON

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and very light. Durability might be a concern.
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous edition of this and they worked fairly well but if you leave your tools around or aren't very careful, you might want a different hose. These are very light weight but they can easily get damaged. I bought a few of these before and my dad would always damage the hose because there would be a rip or a cut. Overall, I do enjoy the product but you have to be cautious on where it is or what it touches.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Hose shrinkage!  Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions in the box indicate if you are using the nozzle on full, shower (which I use continuously), cone or soaker the hose may experience some shrinkage. It’s a little more than “some.” It shrinks to about 10 ft. Instructions note it’s because of my water pressure. Hogwash! I’ve been using retractable hoses for years and always use the full & shower settings with never any shrinkage. None of this is noted in the description on Amazon! Sending it back and having my money returned. Useless, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D. Maryjanowski

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last four months
customer_reviews.text: This hose worked great and was lightweight and easy to move around. Unfortunately, it has sprung a leak near the base after just under four months of use. I am really disappointed because it really did simplify projects when I didn't need to haul a heavy hose around.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear of Boys

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I believe we received a faulty product. We used the product not even 15 times to wash our vehicles and within a year it’s splitting in 4 different places (and we brought this inside during the winter and kept this in great shape) I’m really hoping the company can send us a replacement given the cost of the item.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hose
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this hose because it could stretch 100’. Here’s the kicker, it doesn’t stretch past 15-20’ if you have water flowing out the head of the hose. It needs water to fill the hose to stretch so the pressure of you pinching the end makes it stretch past ~15ft. We’ll build but common...a 15’ hose is just stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Greg C.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty hose with easy to use sprayer
customer_reviews.text: I got this heavy duty expandable hose to replace my as-seen-on-TV flexible one, which was punctured in several sections. This hose fits my 3/4" bib perfectly without any leaks (it has a rubber fitting inside). In addition to the long length, the material and the thickness are superior to my previous green hose so I hope it would last longer. It must be mentioned that the sprayer is good as well with the push pull control rather than the old squeeze sprayer. So far, I have used this hose to connect to my electronic power washer without any issue. Overall, if you're tired of replacing the generic expendable hose ones, give this heavy duty version a try.
customer_reviews.author: Huang's Family

customer_reviews.title: Non-kink but expensive for the $$$!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hose once before in the 100’ length- within a few uses it had already developed some pinhole “pressure” leaks- and at 6 months it ripped entirely from the outside water connection makin it useless and making me mad! The new 50’ hose my wife ordered for me for my birthday this past July. I made a loop at the connection so it won’t tear again, at least not there. Otherwise it is kink free, it is easily handled but I believe it’s over-priced after my fiasco with the first one. The regular hose I had prior to the 100’ non kink purchase lasted me 12 years!! So, it’s your money, spend it wisely. ~K.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O’Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Not a good quality hose!
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this hose based on the great reviews it received. But, after only three months of having this hose, it no longer works. Very dissatisfied that it broke so soon with such little use. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia N.

customer_reviews.title: Not durable whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Hardly used as this hose lives on our front porch and all our plants have a drip system. Have turned it on maybe 10 to 15 times maximum. Hose is super flexible and easy to store, yet zero stars for durability. The hose after only six months of use literally burst in the middle portion and is now unable to be used. Love the idea of the hose, but definitely not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. It didn’t last five months.
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved the sprayer and turn off valve attached. However, the hose itself is a pain. Very hard to Circle around a wall mount. Does not stretch well because twirls tight. It’s already leaking at the faucet and it sprung a leak in a stationary place where the hose hangs from the mounted hanger. I do not recommend this hose. And it’s too late for a refund - not even six months old.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stec

customer_reviews.title: Was great... til it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I hate having to haul a big long hose around so the stretch was key. However, I used it for about 3 weeks and it spring a leak. No big deal, I thought. 1 small leak will not be the end of the world. But, then another leak. And another. Now my hose basically leaks all over and I'm going to have to replace it. I'm very unhappy with the durability of it.
customer_reviews.author: cdeee

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in April. Being handicapped these were very easy to water with, very light, worked very well for what I purchased them for. Less than 6 months... Both are in the trash and I have a third one that is leaking as well. That’s close to $100 down the drain. Both hoses burst in two different locations on the hose. While these may be very light and easy to maneuver, they will not last. Do not purchase these hoses.
customer_reviews.author: PSF

customer_reviews.title: Lasted three months - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The hose sprang a pinhole leak within three months of use. The hose is used daily to water potted patio plants. I contacted FitLife, and they promised to send a replacement. After attempting to contact them again, no response. Will update this review if I can get a response or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Drew E

customer_reviews.title: Sprung a pinhole leak within nine months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hose on May 19, 2019. I use the hose approximately 15 times and it developed a pinhole leak in the nylon section of the hose about 1 foot from the nozzle end. I am going to give it another shot and re-buying it but would like to hear from the manufacture if they improve this at all
customer_reviews.author: Greg giordano

customer_reviews.title: Pin Hole Leaks..Update
customer_reviews.text: Defective hose......Bought this hose at the beginning of summer....less than 2 months later...developed a pinhole leak at the connector and of course the return window closed on July 30....bought 3 of these hoses and am hoping the same thing does not happen on my other two...very disappointed in the quality as it was easy of work with by having a leak in less than two months does not speak much for the enduring quality of this product...buyer beware!! UPDATE: The company did send a replacement hose..but after a month...multiple leaks in the new hose...tried to give this company a chance...but really a waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shoddy

customer_reviews.title: It does not expand as long as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the hose thinking it would expand to 25ft knowing most products don't, figured 20ft sadly neither. I was lucky if I reached 10ft with this! Whilst its light weight and the hose does not kink, which is great! I only got to get the hose to stretch to 8ft. So either my hose is defective or they just really expand to what they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Light-Weight Hose
customer_reviews.text: This hose is perfect for watering my small garden, washing the garage floor and cleaning the deck & front & back porches. It is the "retractable/stretchy" type which I've used before. However, I believe I've stretched them too far and somehow damaged the liner inside the hose which then causes splits or small holes that begin leaking and are impossible to repair. So, I'm treating this hose much kinder and it's working very well. It does sit in the hot summer sun all morning so I hope that won't dry it out so much that it starts cracking as many of my other brands have.
customer_reviews.author: Volunteer

customer_reviews.title: Hose Failed in less than one year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in the summer of 2019. It worked for the balance of the season. I stored it away for the winter and brought it back out this summer. It failed after a few uses. It started with a leak and the entire hose collapsed and quit working. I love the concept of this type of collapsible hose, but this is third one I have bought and every one of them failed within a year. They are made to be disposable, not last for years. Will not make the same mistake again. Buying a traditional hose this time as I know it will last.
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: NOT 75 Feet
customer_reviews.text: I only needed the hose to go 45-50 ft with a sprinkler. It will not go that far. This only gets close to 75" when under pressure and that's if you are stretching it. Once you start the water running, either through the nozzle or a sprinkler it shrinks up almost to box size. Sending it back. :(
customer_reviews.author: Jrarmadillo

customer_reviews.title: Material tears easily at nozzle conmection
customer_reviews.text: We just bought this house only 3 weeks ago, and at first we loved everything about it until a hole developed in the material where the spray nozzle is connected to the hose. I was actually thinking about buying a second hose for our cabin, but will not waste the money!
customer_reviews.author: P Bosh

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago and so far, I am very pleased. I have a large back yard and I can keep this hose on my patio and stretch it to every flower bed in the yard. When I am done, it shrinks back up- and It’s easy to store. I love that it doesn’t kink up and it’s light weight. Much, much better than the thick, rubber hoses I have used in the past. I will probably purchase another one for my front yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mindylou

customer_reviews.title: Nice attachments for variable spray
customer_reviews.text: I got this hose for my elderly parents so they could store it more easily and have different spraying options for watering plants and spraying off their car. The nozzle is good and it stores easily, but I felt as though the stretch took a great deal of pulling which was a bit of a disappointment as I have an expandable hose of a different brand and it stretched easily on the first use. The hose doesn't leak which is important and it does the job I got it to do, I just wish it stretched more easily for hands and shoulders that are no longer young and strong.
customer_reviews.author: KLHR

customer_reviews.title: Done Buying Expandable Hoses
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I’ve boughten and it was the worst. The first I bought was left out for the winter...my bad. The second lasted one summer season. This one didn’t even last a month. At least with a rubber or vinyl hose, I can taken them and get some more life. Once these pop, they are done. I’m going back to old school hose!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: 75 Foot???? Not a chance
customer_reviews.text: The hose is okay and seems like it should last a reasonable amount of time, although the "keep your hose in the shade seems kinda silly. Who keeps their garden hose in the shade? Not me. My real issue is with the claim that it will grow to 75' when pressurized. NOT A CHANCE..... maybe, maybe somewhere between 50' & 60' on a good day. TGHis thing wouldn't reach 75' in length if you used it to repel down a cliff.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: this is great after using regular hoses for many years
customer_reviews.text: very pleased with the product. when not under pressure, it contracts neatly into a small space. It looks kind of weird when you turn on the pressure b/c it literally looks like a snake moving. gave me the willies when I first saw that. anyway, I was so pleased that I bought a second one (both are 100ft fully expanded under normal faucet pressure). My only concern is how long it will last. so far, it looks pretty good, and I will make sure to bring it in once the frosts start. that reminds me of another nice feature - it is light and very manageable.
customer_reviews.author: C. David Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Less than half the promised length
customer_reviews.text: This hose is a joke. I purchased the 50ft hose. I followed ALL of the instructions. I watched the video that I was directed to in the owner’s guide. The hose is about 12ft at its longest (when filled with water, and the hose’s valve is closed). I am so frustrated. I’ll take a picture and post in the next day or so; so no one else gets saddled with this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Lerma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this kind of hose, this is second time I bought 2 of them. The first and the best part I like is the flexibility of handling the hose. You don't have to worry about extending the hose, straighting the hose, returning, folding etc. It is kind of burdensome especially when you are getting older. I intend to buy some more for my two adult children for their convenience in handling the hose. A job well done.
customer_reviews.author: Carol H. Bisht

customer_reviews.title: Buy this hose
customer_reviews.text: I’m not one of these super nerds who over analyzes stuff...this is easy and simple...this hose is great. The brass fixtures are excellent and solid, the hose itself is sturdy and light, and the nozzle it comes with is very good. For this price, get this hose. I’m on my 2nd one, this one for the rear of the house. I’m tossing the rubber junk one I have back there now.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Best Hose I have ever had (with one exception.)
customer_reviews.text: Fast, light, easy, doesn't drip--all great! But I took off one star only because the first one of these I had punctured and sprung a leak when it gently caught on the siding of my house. I have since easily solved that spot in the siding with a bit of heavy tape, and I really love this hose and the nozzle that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny U

customer_reviews.title: Very good if your expectations are reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: This hose has some high quality construction features and it is very light and flexible. Perfect for many low use applications. But don't expect it to be a rugged hose for everyday use. As a dedicated hose for car, boat or RV wash it will work nicely. As a rugged garden hose left in the sun and used every day, it may disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cvetetic

customer_reviews.title: It didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Got this in June and really liked it until it separated from the nozzle fittings and soaked everything. Would like to send it back but no information or way to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: ardie

customer_reviews.title: Expandable Indeed
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about the expandable hose, as i have very limited storage at my place. but to my surprise, the hose when not in use is very compact and can be easily stored, and when in use, it expanded as listed. the brass connectors are added advantage as they are very durable, even the look and feel tells you that this is very durable. i got this to do cleaning of my car with my kid, who wanted to help, and this is a fun activity showing him how the hose expands. we have been washing our cars now every weekend. good pass time for the kid wiith this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Unifreek

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Got this product on June, and the hose is already broken (tear). Want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Heitor Medrado de Faria

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hose
customer_reviews.text: The TheFitLife Flexible and Expandable Garden Hose - Strongest Triple Latex Core with 3/4" Solid Brass Fittings Free 8 Function Spray Nozzle, Easy Storage Kink Free Water Hose (100 FT) is a VERY good hose. I love the nozzle and you can spray in different ways. I bought the 100 foot, but it also stretches. This will be well used this summer.
customer_reviews.author: lawlf

customer_reviews.title: This is a really strong hose
customer_reviews.text: After buying so many different expandable hoses, and having them break I decided to opt for a more expensive one. I received this hose a few days ago and as soon as I attached it, I could see the difference. It is strong and I don't feel it will break. I ordered a second one for the back of the house since the cheap one I had there broke today! I also ordered one for a friend who was also tired of broken hoses and upon seeing mine, decided to get one too. I don't have it very long but I think it will work just fine. I recommend this hose.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good price...not quality
customer_reviews.text: Great design and poor material.....nozzle didn't last 7 months and started leaking when shut off.....cheap plastic. Hose last 11 months and suddenly split open....both went into the garbage can...will not suggest anyone buy this.
customer_reviews.author: George Nenadovich

customer_reviews.title: The outlet connect part is leaking
customer_reviews.text: The product simply doesn't work. The end that connect to my water outlets is leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Chuanqi Zhu

customer_reviews.title: 100% JUNK..........
customer_reviews.text: This product curls and kinks up. The part you hold in your hand/nozzle kinks up. Biggest disappointment. 100% JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey cross

customer_reviews.title: High quality expandable pose
customer_reviews.text: This is nice expandable hose with sprayer that is very light and maneuverable. Shower/sprayer has different abilities that are easy adjustable. High quality with metal connectors and washers. Won't fold and break like traditional rubber hoses. I use it for my garden. . When you turn the water on, the hose expands to it's full length. After you turn the water off, as the water leaves the hose, the hose contracts back to its smallest size. So far, it appears to be made quite well. Its expansion qualities are excellent. The spray nozzles included, are made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Hoppy Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but only for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: This hose worked great for a few months but then it started leaking where the hose meets the tap, making it useless. I’m very disappointed because I was so happy with it while it worked.
customer_reviews.author: LittleContessa

customer_reviews.title: Light and very easy to stow, holding up well.
customer_reviews.text: So far after onw month of use of the 75 ft version I am extremely happy. Brass fittings have held up nice and there are no leaks on the hose itself. Shrinks up to a really manageable length and a weight of a couple pounds without water. No kinking has been noticed. The free nozzle is ok, but the flow from that is a bit lower than normal nozzles. Flow overall seems a bit lower than traditional hoses, but you'll barely notice. If you want a light hose that stows easily, this is a top choice.
customer_reviews.author: Max Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased a longer length hose
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for watering a small garden patch. I only ordered the 25' long hose because the area to be watered was so small, but the hose is so lightweight and maneuverable, that a 50' or even the 100' hose could have done my whole yard! My experience with these types of hoses in the past have not been good as they very quickly spring tiny holes in the fabric of the hose. I have not used this one very much so far, but I hope the fabric is sturdier and more puncture resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Sucks broke a little after a month. Barely used it and it got a hole
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Flora

customer_reviews.title: Not a 50' hose
customer_reviews.text: It may expand to close to 50' when pressurized but when you open the valve.........then it shrinks to about 25-30 feet. spray nozzle is a bit on the cheap side
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hose and have to say it worked great for 5 months, then it sprung a leak. Contacted the manufacturer, and they sent me a new one. Good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Robish

customer_reviews.title: My wife made me buy this. And I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical and hesitant to buy this style hose but after enough pestering by my wife I promised to try it out after our current hose went bad. It went bad and I kept my promise. It is soooooo much better! It coils up way easier, is much lighter to walk around with, and super flexible. I was always cursing using our traditional hose but that's what I was used to. We'll see if it stands up to the test of time but for now I am really happy with it and consider myself converted.
customer_reviews.author: DC de DC

customer_reviews.title: I have only used it a few times...
customer_reviews.text: so take that with a grain of salt. But so far, the hose seems very durable, it's a little heavier than other shrinkable hoses I have owned but I also think it will hold up better because it does have a stronger feel to it. it does shrink up and stores nicely. I like the fittings, they seem to be well made. I did wrap a little plumber's tape on the fitting at the spigot. If anything changes...I'll be back!
customer_reviews.author: trishinpitt

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and compact.
customer_reviews.text: So I've only had this a day and I've only used it once... But so far it's great. I live in a townhouse with a small yard/patio. I have some plants out there and I've been struggling with a standard hose for the last 4 years. This is better. I like how small it shrinks, there's no effort required to put it away. It stretches out fine for my needs (I purchased the 25 foot hose as that is the length of my old one). I hope it lasts for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May, it is now the middle of September and the hose has several holes in it. It is unrepairable. Used the hose as anyone would....for yard stuff etc. Didn’t do anything out of the ordinary with it so I have zero clue why the holes appeared. Not impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even last a full season
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hose as a father’s day gift and it didn’t even last until the end of the season before it got a hole. We have a very mild yard with pebbles which could have been the only thing to cause this which is sad as that would indicate the quality is pretty poor.
customer_reviews.author: Dru Pattan

customer_reviews.title: Expands and contracts beautifully, super lightweight, easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This hose is really compact when not in use but expands beautifully to full 25-foot length when water is flowing. It comes with an extra washer but I ended up using both to make sure it doesn't leak from the place where the hose attaches to the spigot. No leaks anywhere else. Shut-off valve near nozzle seems unnecessary but it works. Hose is extremely lightweight and flexible, very easy to maneuver all over the garden, although I never drag it over the ground so I can't speak to how it would hold up to that. I already had a nozzle so the one that came with the hose is now my spare.
customer_reviews.author: Ella Greggs

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like, but 3 so far have sprung a leak
customer_reviews.text: They last about a month, these! Not buying again, despite the pleasant form factor. Badly made.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Taylor

customer_reviews.title: lot's of things to like about this hose
customer_reviews.text: I would think there's too much to say about a garden hose but I really like this design that takes up less space when it's not being used. The expansion function works well. It gives you good reach so you can get water where you want it. The connection hardware seems durable as well. The included nozzle is a nice bonus. Overall, it's a solid, expandable garden hose.
customer_reviews.author: Consumerist

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, reasonably durable, shrinks nicely.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We’ve used the hose a few times a week, and although we are more gentle with it than our other typical hose, it is somewhat durable. Even if this only last two years I’d buy it again for how easy it makes watering.
customer_reviews.author: T. Basic

customer_reviews.title: Favorite of all our hoses!
customer_reviews.text: Our favorite of all our hoses! My husband wanted to replace all our hoses with this brand. I love that it’s so lightweight I can easily use it even while 9 months pregnant. The water pressure is amazing and the metal spout attached is excellent, we don’t even use the plastic spray nozzle on it. Love that you can switch it on and off and can even adjust pressure with the switch. The plastic spray nozzle is on our other backyard hose so it’s a nice bonus and works great As well.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I was confused with some review, still bought. Firstly I realized it's not expanding to 25 ft, so wrote to manufacturer, they asked to retest and offered even one more additional 25 ft. But when I tested again, it worked and expand till 25ft. Like the product. Not taken the offer, but really appreciate the gesture. Good product, save space and expands quickly, will buy one more.
customer_reviews.author: nk

product_meta.title: TheFitLife Flexible and Expandable Garden Hose - Strongest Triple Latex Core with 3/4" Solid Brass Fittings Free 8 Function Spray Nozzle, Easy Storage Kink Free Water Hose (50 FT)
feature_bullets: DESIGNED TO MAKE YOUR LIFE EASIER: The newest design expandable water hose pipe never tangles, twists or kinks. Only 2.7 lbs, after getting your work done, just simply rewind it into a basket or hose hanger. Lightweight, collapsible, easy storage makes your life easier.

A RETRACTABLE HOSE SUITABLE FOR MULTIPLE PURPOSES: Expanding quickly, while a brass valve at the end allows better control of the flow of water, flexible length and proper water flow to support multiple purposes, such as gardening, watering, car/boat washing, pet bathing or pool cleaning, returns to original length in seconds when the water is out, an amazing hose you will never regret buying.

PREMIUM QUALITY MAKES USEFUL LIFE MUCH LONGER: Triple layer latex inner wrapped by newest and strongest interwoven elasticated fabric, with 3/4" USA standard solid brass fittings, our hoses are endurance tested to 1800-2000 uses while the typical hose is only 200-250 uses under the water pressure of 145 PSI/10 Bar. No more bursts, cracks, leaks or corrosion, it’s time to say goodbye to your old style leaking hose!

BONUS FREE SPRAY NOZZLE: TheFitLife new spray nozzle, providing 8 patterns support to fulfill your different watering purposes, ease of use and more durable than the typical fragile nozzle, completely free bonus!

GET YOUR EXPANDABLE HOSE NOW: Available in 25 feet, 50 feet, 75 feet, 100 feet and they are connectable for getting a longer size, like 125 feet, 150 feet or 200 feet. You’ll feel 100% satisfaction from the moment you received our expandable garden hose and we are quite sure that you will be super-impressed with the durability, protability, versatility and high quality of it.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,611 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
